result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J. Lawn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Charles J. Lawn was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles J. Lawn is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Charles J. Lawn was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Charles J. Lawn was found guilty of Aggravated Battery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Charles J. Lawn was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Charles J. Lawn was found guilty of Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NOT Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & NOT eligible Substance Abuse programs.    Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises Enter, participate in, and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent; may not withdraw from any treatment program involved in unless given the express permission of the Agent and treatment provider.  Take medications as prescribed by treating physician.  Participate in a psychological evaluation/assessment and follow through with recommended counseling.  Cooperate with and complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  No illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. Submit to a DNA sample.  Pay costs and supervision fees as directed by the agent.  Pay restitution to David Strahota as determined due by the court and in amounts as set by your agent.    Not to own or possess any firearms.  No contact with David Strahota or his residence, without prior agent approval.

Defendant Charles J. Lawn in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given at 12:30 pm.  Victim rights complied with and the victim wishes to address the court.  Cont sentencing from May 24, 2016.  Include the report from Vermont thru DOC as a sealed entry in the court record. PSI is to be sealed by the clerk.  The restitution amount is agreeable by the parties in the amount of $76.74 payable to the victim.  Victim makes a statement to the court.  Factual errors of PSI - stating he has a daugther named Gail this not correct.  No other errors.   Arguements heard in regards to sentencing.  Court questions the deft regarding the PSI. Court takes a break until 1:45 pm.  Back on the record at 2:07 pm.  Court addresses the deft.  State addresses the court.  Victim wants a fact made known to the court.  

Court orders:
Count 2:
5 years initial conf; 3 years extended Supervision - STAYED
7 1/2 years probation - IMPOSED
1 year jail - to be taken into custody after court w/huber for employment and AODA treatment
$500 fine +   Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Conditions set forth on page 17 of PSI
$76.74 restitution to victim
Sentence credit to be determined by 6/17/16 @ 4:30 pm
NOT  Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & NOT eligible Substance Abuse programs

Count 3:
2 years initial conf; 1 year extended supervision - STAYED
3 year probation - IMPOSED
$250 fine +   Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Conditions set forth on page 17 of PSI

Count 4
9 months jail w/huber - STAYED
2 years probation - IMPOSED
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Conditions set forth on page 17 of PSI

Count 5
9 months jail w/huber - STAYED
2 years probation - IMPOSED
  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Conditions set forth on page 17 of PSI

All counts are concurrent to each other.

Defendant Charles J. Lawn in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Victim is in the courtroom and would like to address the court.  Errors in the PSI.  Page 8&9 - daugther(Gail) does not have a daugther named Gail. Page 6 - event did not happen as stated in PSI.  State has contacted the Probation Office - Patti Baacke.  Probation will check into the release of the information.  Court to take a break - waiting for a call back from Probation.  On the record at 10:58 a.m. Reports received from Patti Baacke, CFS, DOC.   Court addresses the victim if he understands what is going on.  Parties feel they need time to review the documents.  Court grants and adjournment for parties to review the documents from Vermont.  Rescheduled in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Charles J. Lawn in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given at 9:06 am.  Day 3 of trial.  Victim is present in the courtroom.  Jurors in the courtroom at 9:10 am.  Court reads the jury instructions to the jurors.   Court breaks on instructions  State to give closing arguements 9:38 am.  Break before defense gives closing.  Defense gives closing arguement 10:48 am.  State rebuttal closings 11:05 am. Court gives final instructions at 11:15 am.  Clerk picks two jurors to be excuses they were Patricia Voermans and Patti Schmitz.  (list was verified to the slips)  Juror excused to deliberate at 11:26 am.  Back in the courtroom.  Jurors have a question at 12:12 pm.  Regarding empty casings in house.  Court decides to tell the jurors they need to relay on they memory regarding the evidence.  Court to write respond on question.  

Verdict from jury at 2:00 pm.  Jurors in the courtroom at 2:05 pm
Juror 1159 -
Count 1 - not guilty
Count 2 - guilty
Count 3 - guilty
Count 4 - guilty
Count 5 - guilty

State / Defense do not require the jury to be polled.  Juror are excused from duty.

Defendant Charles J. Lawn in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:36 am Appearances given.  Day 2 of a 3 day trial.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Defense attorney addresses the court. Court advises the parties as to a note received from a juror.  Jury back into the courtroom at 8:42 am.  Court addresses the question that was given to the court from Juror #7.  Chief AL Alvins  duly sworn and testifies.  Jurors excused do to the issues with Mr Davies and his testimony.  Jurors back in the courtroom 9:12 am.  Court instructs the jurors to struck the last question asked by the defense.  Ryan Picl  duly sworn and testifies.    Jurors are instructed to disregard the statement of prior shootings.  Tom Tollefson   duly sworn and testifies.  Jurors excued 10:02 am.  State informs the court the next witness is not prepared to testify.  Defense has some concerns of this issue.  Back on the record at 10:36 am  Jurors back into the courtroom.  John Duplayee  duly sworn and testifies.  State rests at 10:48 am.  Jurors are excused.  Defense has some motions for the court to hear.  Defense moves to dismiss Counts 1, 2 &3.  Arguements heard.  Court rules to deny the motion.  Defense is ready to  proceed.  State will ask if convicted of a crime and is looking for an answer of "2" Defense does not object.  Court accepts.  Jurors back at 10:55 am  Bryan Muenchow   duly sworn and testifies.  Jury is excused due to a request by defense need to address the court.  Reporter reminds the parties to talk one at a time.  Jurors are back in the courtroom 11:13 am.  Defense continues the questioning of Bryan Muenchow.  Jurors excused 11:15 am.  Another legal issue to be discussed.  Back on the record 11:22 am.  Court rules to allow the questioning by the defense, Court limits it to a few questions.  Jurors back at 11:37 questioning continues of Bryan Muenchow.  Jurors excussed will determined time jurors need to back.  Jurors to be back by 1:15 pm.

Back on the record Jurors in the courtroom at 1:24 pm.  Tammy Guite(by phone)  duly sworn and testifies.  Gregory Guite(by phone)  duly sworn and testifies. Sidebar requested by the court at 1:32 pm (regarding the deft testifing)  Court advises the deft as to his rights to testify.  FVI Jurors back 1:39 pm  Defense rests at 1:40 pm State calls rebuttal witnesses David Strahota   duly sworn and testifies.  John DuPlayee  duly sworn and testifies.  Anthony Klein  duly sworn and testifies.  State rests after the rebuttal.  Jurors excused at 1:53 pm.  Court addresses the parties as to the time of things yet to do.  Instructions to be completed today.  Jurors to report at 9:00 am on Wednesday.  Jurors are excused for the day at 2:01 pm.  Back on the record at 3:34 pm after the Court, State and Defense worked on the jury instruction off the record.  All parties agree on the jury instructions.    Exhibits can be given to the jury if asked for.  Be back at in the courtroom by 8:45 am on Wednesday.

Defendant Charles J. Lawn in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  State's motion to be heard regarding statements made by the deft.  Anthon Klein duly sworn and testifies.  Ryan Picl  duly sworn and testifies.  Court takes a break to decide ruling.  Back on the record at 9;18 am Court rules to grant the state's motion regarding the statements.  Court would like to alternate jurors both sides fine with alternates juror.  Both are OK with jurors taking notes.  Court review list of witnesses.  State updates their witness list, Defense will only have two witnesses.
Jury selection stated at 9:50 am Completed at 11:15 am.    Sidebars 10:35 - last 2 strikes selection.  11:02 am - after drawing names by lot - judge knew two of the jurors. No objection from either party.  Jurors into the courtroom 11:38 am.  Court gives opening jury instructions.  State gives opening statement at 11:47 am  Defense gives opening statement at 12:00 pm.  Court excuses the jurors for lunch to back at 1:20 pm  Nothing to place on the record from the parties.  Court staff to be back at 1:05 pm.

Back on the records at 1:11 pm.   Mr Davis wishes to take the 5th amendment.  Mr. Davis appears with Atty Corey Mehlos.  Court questions Mr Davis. Court grants the witnesses the 5th amendment and finds him unavailable.  State motions the court to give the witness amunity.   Court grants the state's motion for the deft to testify.  Clerk has brought to the courts attention that there is a possible problem with a juror.  Defense requests the witnesses be sequestered.  That goes for witnesses on both sides.  The victim does not have to be part of the sequestion.  Court questions the bailiff as to what occurrs.  Arguements heard about excusing the 14th juror.  Defense requests a mistrial.  Arguements heard.  Court takes a break to review the law.  Back on the record 2:08 pm.  Court addresses the deft as to what is going to happen.  Court gives the ruling on declaring a mistrial.  Court grants a mistrial, (due to late this case can be reschedule for a new jury trial. The jurors are called into the courtroom to explain as to what has happened.  Jurors are excused from their duty on this case.

Attorney James T. Runyon appeared. Deft's attorney is in court on behalf.  Along with the employers of the deft. Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney states that all conditions are being complied with.  All parties agree that everything is being complied with.

Shall not consume alcholic beverages or go on tavern premises, No firearms, not toleave Lincoln County Except for medical or employment as follows:
The deft will be allowed to drive for Elite Carries (Greg and Tammy Guite) All conditions of the current bond remain in effect.  
May leave Lincoln County employment purposes with Elite Carries subject to:
1. Deft as a local truck driver for elite Carries shall not operate a truck a route in excess of 130 miles from Merrill, WI
2. Deft shall return every evening back to his home
3. Any truck operated by the deft shall be equiped w/GPS and on board logging and tracked by Elite Carries dispatch.
4. Tammy and Greg Guite agree to immediately report to LISO any devation or problems with determined by them or their dispatch as result of the deft operation of a truck on an assigned route given by Elite Carriers to the deft.
